meanings.definition: A pointed hammer head, typically used for shaping metal.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith carefully selected a pein to shape the hot metal.
meanings.sent2: The pein is an essential tool for metalworkers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous apprentice used the pein as a pretend microphone during break time.
meanings.sent4: The pein struck the metal with precision, like a conductor directing an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The shiny pein gleamed in the sunlight as it hammered the metal into shape.

meanings.definition: To cause physical or mental pain.
meanings.sent1: Loud noises can pein sensitive ears.
meanings.sent2: The injury will pein for a while before healing.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food unexpectedly peined his taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The loss of a loved one can pein the heart deeply.
meanings.sent5: The harsh words seemed to pein her soul more than anything else.

meanings.definition: A type of woodworking tool with a pointed end for making holes in leather or wood.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman used a pein to create precise holes in the leather.
meanings.sent2: The pein is perfect for making holes in wooden planks.
meanings.sent3: The curious child mistook the pein for a giant needle.
meanings.sent4: The pein pierced through the wood effortlessly, like a hot knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: The old pein had seen many years of hard work, yet it remained sharp and reliable.
